titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Henry Limrick, Henry Limrick, William H. Shryock, Riley Oder, and Joseph Simpson, Indictment
CWG7263

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Grant Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky, Plaintiff.
against } Indictment for Felony
Henry Limrick, Wm H. Shryock, Riley Oder, Joseph Simpson Defendants

The Grand Jury of Grant County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Henry Shryock, Wm H. Shryock, Riley Oder and Joseph Simpson of the offense of willfully and maliciously shooting at and wounding another, with intention to kill such other person, so that such other pserson did not ^die^ thereby -- Committed as follows viz. The said Henry Limrick, Wm H Shryock, Riley Oder & Joseph Simpson, in the County, Circuit and State aforesaid, on the day of February 1864, did undlawfully, feloniously, willfully and maliciously shoot at and wound J. R. Jamison with a gun loaded with powder and a leaden bullet or other hard substance, with the intention to kill the said J R. Jamison, so that the said J. R. Jamison did not die thereby -- Contrary to the Statute in such Case made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

John L. Scott
Commonwealths attorney for 8th Judicial Dis^trict^
Endorsed. "Filed Oct. 28th 1865."

Witnesses for Commonwealth.
J. R. Jamison,
G. W. Nichols
Charles OHara.
Morgan Simpson.
T. J. McGinnis
T. L Clark.

Endorsed.
"A true Bill -- T. S. Jeffers foreman"
A copy att. N. H. Jeffers C. G. C. C.

Commonwealth
vs } copy of Indict.
Limrick & others
